rescuecore2.config
Class Config

java.lang.Object
  rescuecore2.config.Config

public class Config
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a config file and any other config files that might have been included with a !include directive. Config files must be defined relative to a base directory so that includes can be resolved.

          Create an empty config.

Constructor Detail

Config

public Config()
Create an empty config.

Config

public Config(java.io.File file)
       throws ConfigException
Create a config that reads from a given file. Additional config files can be read later with the read(String) method.

Parameters:
file - The config file to read. Must not be null.
Throws:
ConfigException - If there is an error parsing the config file or one of its descendants.

Config

public Config(Config other)
Copy constructor. The new Config will contain all keys and values that are currently in this config.

Parameters:
other - The Config to copy.
Method Detail

read

public void read(java.lang.String resource)
          throws ConfigException
Read a config file from a resource that this class' classloader can find.

Parameters:
resource - The name of the resource.
Throws:
ConfigException - If there is an error parsing the config file or one of its descendants.

read

public void read(java.io.File file)
          throws ConfigException
Read a config file and add its contents. Existing entries with the same name will be overwritten.

Parameters:
file - The config file to read. Must not be null. If this is a directory then all files in the directory tree will be read.
Throws:
ConfigException - If there is an error parsing the config file or one of its descendants.

read

public void read(java.io.Reader reader,
                 java.lang.String name)
          throws ConfigException
Read config information from a Reader and add its contents. Existing entries with the same name will be overwritten.

Parameters:
reader - The Reader to read from. Must not be null.
name - The name of the reader being read. This is used when reporting errors in the file.
Throws:
ConfigException - If there is an error parsing the config file or one of its descendants.

write

public void write(java.io.PrintWriter out)
           throws java.io.IOException
Write this config to a PrintWriter.

Parameters:
out - The PrintWriter to write to. Must not be null.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is an error writing to the stream.

public void merge(Config other)
Merge all keys and values from another Config into this one.

Parameters:
other - The Config to merge from.

Parameters:

getValue

public java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String key)
Get the value of a key as a String.

Parameters:
key - The key to look up. Must not be null.
Returns:
The value associated with that key.
Throws:
NoSuchConfigOptionException - If the key is not defined.

getValue

public java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String key,
                                 java.lang.String defaultValue)
Get the value of a key as a String or use a default value.

Parameters:
key - The key to look up. Must not be null.
defaultValue - The default value to return if the key has no defined value.
Returns:
The value associated with that key, or the default value of the key has no value.

getIntValue

public int getIntValue(java.lang.String key)
Get the value of a key as an integer.

Parameters:
key - The key to look up. Must not be null.
Returns:
The value associated with that key interpreted as an integer.
Throws:
NoSuchConfigOptionException - If the key is not defined.
java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the value of the key cannot be interpreted as an integer.

Returns:
The value associated with that key interpreted as an integer, or the default value of the key has no value.

java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the value of the key cannot be interpreted as an integer.

getBooleanValue

public boolean getBooleanValue(java.lang.String key)
Get the value of a key as a boolean. "true", "t", "yes", "y" and "1" (case insensitive) are all interpreted as true, all other values are false.

Parameters:
key - The key to look up. Must not be null.
Returns:
The value associated with that key interpreted as a boolean.
Throws:
NoSuchConfigOptionException - If the key is not defined.

getBooleanValue

public boolean getBooleanValue(java.lang.String key,
                               boolean defaultValue)
Get the value of a key as a boolean or use a default value. "true", "t", "yes", "y" and "1" (case insensitive) are all interpreted as true, all other values are false.

Parameters:
key - The key to look up. Must not be null.
defaultValue - The default value to return if the key has no defined value.
Returns:
The value associated with that key interpreted as a boolean, or the default value of the key has no value.

getArrayValue

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getArrayValue(java.lang.String key)
Get the value of a key as an array of strings. The value will be split on space and comma characters and the resulting list of tokens is returned.

Parameters:
key - The key to look up. Must not be null.
Returns:
The value associated with that key interpreted as an array of space-and-comma-separated tokens.
Throws:
NoSuchConfigOptionException - If the key is not defined.

getArrayValue

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getArrayValue(java.lang.String key,
                                                      java.lang.String defaultValue)
Get the value of a key (or a default value) as an array of strings. The value will be split on space and comma characters and the resulting list of tokens is returned.

Parameters:
key - The key to look up. Must not be null.
defaultValue - The default value to use if the key is not defined. If this is null then null will be returned, otherwise it will be split according to the usual rules.
Returns:
The value associated with the key (or the default value) interpreted as an array of space or comma-separated tokens.

setValue

public void setValue(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.String value)
Set the value of a key.

Parameters:
key - The key to set. Must not be null.
value - The new value. If this is null then removeKey(String) is called with the given key.

appendValue

public void appendValue(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String value)
Append a value to a key. If there is no value for the key then this is equivalent to setValue(String, String). This method calls appendValue(String, String, String) with a space character as the separator.

Parameters:
key - The key to append.
value - The value to append.

appendValue

public void appendValue(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String value,
                        java.lang.String separator)
Append a value to a key. If there is no value for the key then this is equivalent to setValue(String, String).

Parameters:
key - The key to append.
value - The value to append.
separator - A string to add before the new value to separate it from the previous value.

setIntValue

public void setIntValue(java.lang.String key,
                        int value)
Set the value of a key as an integer.

Parameters:
key - The key to set. Must not be null.
value - The new value.

key - The key to set. Must not be null.

value - The new value.

removeKey

public void removeKey(java.lang.String key)
Remove a key from the config.

Parameters:
key - The key to remove. Must not be null.

Remove all except a set of keys.

Parameters:
exceptions - The keys to keep.

public void removeExcept(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> exceptions)
Remove all except a set of keys.

Parameters:
exceptions - The keys to keep.

removeExceptRegex

public void removeExceptRegex(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> exceptions)
Remove all keys that do not match any of the given regular expressions.

Parameters:
exceptions - The regular expressions describing keys to keep.

getRandom

public java.util.Random getRandom()
Get the random number generator defined by this config.

Returns:
The random number generator.
